Class FourierTransform

java.lang.Object
  FourierTransform
Direct Known Subclasses:
NaiveFourierTransform, RecursiveFourierTransform
public abstract class FourierTransform
extends java.lang.Object

A FourierTransform object can perform various types of Fourier transform operations. All operations are implemented in terms of the standard (forward) Fourier transform. To use this class, subclasses should implement the abstract transform() method.

Author:
Justin Johnson

Method Detail

transform

public abstract ComplexNumber[] transform(ComplexNumber[] input)
The standard one-dimensional discrete (forward) Fourier transform. Subclasses should provide their own implementation of this method.

Parameters:
input - An array of complex numbers to transform.
Returns:
The Fourier transform of input.

transform

public ComplexNumber[] transform(double[] input)
The standard one-dimensional forward Fourier transform with real input. This utility method is implemented in terms of the abstract transform() method.

Parameters:
input - An array of real numbers to transform.
Returns:
The Fourier transform of input.

inverseTransform

public ComplexNumber[] inverseTransform(ComplexNumber[] input)
Performs the one-dimensional inverse Fourier transform. This metho is implemented in terms of the abstract transform() method.

Parameters:
input - An array of complex numbers to transform.
Returns:
The inverse Fourier transform of input.

transform

public ComplexNumber[][] transform(ComplexNumber[][] input)
Performs a two-dimensional (forward) Fourier transform. This method is implemented in terms of the abstract transform() method.

Parameters:
input - A rectangular array of complex numbers to tranform.
Returns:
The Fourier transform of input.

public ComplexNumber[][] inverseTransform(ComplexNumber[][] input)
Performs a two-dimensional inverse Fourier transform. This method is implemented in terms of the abstract transform() method.

Parameters:
input - A rectangular array of complex numbers to transform.
Returns:
The Fourier transform of input.
